FuncDef: This command configures path ID for an MPLS-TP transit path at an LSR. The path ID is equivalent to the MPLS-TP LSP ID and is used to generate the maintenance entity group intermediate point (MIP) identifier for the LSP at the LSR. A path-id must be configured for on-demand OAM to verify an LSP at the LSR.
CLIs: path-id { lsp-num <lsp-num> | working-path | protect-path [ src-global-id <src-global-id> ] src-node-id <src-node-id> src-tunnel-num <src-tunnel-num> [ dest-global-id <dest-global-id> ] dest-node-id <dest-node-id> [ dest-tunnel-num <dest-tunnel-num> ] }

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the LSP number. Values-1 to 65535, or working path, or protect-path. A working-path is equivalent to an lsp-num of 1, and a protect-path is an lsp-num of 2..
Specifies the source global ID. Values-0 to 4294967295.
Specifies the source node ID. Values-a.b.c.d or 1 to 4294967295.
Specifies the source tunnel number. Values-1 to 61440.
Specifies the destination global ID. If the destination global ID is not entered, then it is set to the same value as the source global ID. Values-0 to 4294967295.
Specifies the destination node ID. Values-a.b.c.d or 1 to 4294967295.
Specifies the destination tunnel number. If the destination tunnel number is not entered, then it is set to the same value as the source tunnel number. Values-1 to 61440.
